data.title: Alexander Addison
data.meta_description:
Alexander (known to all as Sandy) Addison was born in Achencoil, Kerala, south India, the son of Lilian and Alexander Addison, a tea plantation manager. Along with his brother, Willie, he would spend the first few years of his life in India and then Ceylon before Lilian and her sons were forced to return to Scotland after the sudden death of his father from a ruptured appendix.

They would initially settle in Tamnavulin in the Scottish Highlands, then move to Aberdeen. Sandy was educated at Keith then Aberdeen grammar schools. He turned down an initial offer to study veterinary medicine because of the need to delay entry, instead opting to study medicine at Aberdeen University, graduating in 1954. …
data.text:
Alexander (known to all as Sandy) Addison was born in Achencoil, Kerala, south India, the son of Lilian and Alexander Addison, a tea plantation manager. Along with his brother, Willie, he would spend the first few years of his life in India and then Ceylon before Lilian and her sons were forced to return to Scotland after the sudden death of his father from a ruptured appendix.

They would initially settle in Tamnavulin in the Scottish Highlands, then move to Aberdeen. Sandy was educated at Keith then Aberdeen grammar schools. He turned down an initial offer to study veterinary medicine because of the need to delay entry, instead opting to study medicine at Aberdeen University, graduating in 1954. …
